verified_group.group_name: Effect of HDPE mass ratio on pyrolysis oil yield
verified_group.variable: mass ratio of HDPE in mixed plastic feedstock

constants.name: pyrolysis temperature
evidence_sentences: At this temperature, the feedstock undergoes thermal decomposition producing vapor/gas and char.

constants.name: heating rate
evidence_sentences: A heating rate of 6 ◦C/min was set, as well as a pyrolysis temperature of 540 ◦C was set using the PID controller.

constants.name: condenser temperature
evidence_sentences: The vapor was passed through the condenser, where a chiller unit chilled with ethylene glycol was set to 15 ◦C temperature to condense the vapor into liquid oil.

constants.name: pressure inside the reactor
evidence_sentences: The pressure inside the reactor was maintained at 30 kPa, and a pressure-relief valve was fitted to release vapor if the pressure exceeded the required threshold.

constants.name: nitrogen purging duration
evidence_sentences: After the nitrogen purging was done, the heater/electric power was turned on, and a heating rate of 6 ◦C/min was set, as well as a pyrolysis temperature of 540 ◦C was set using the PID controller.

constants.name: type of plastic feedstock mixture
evidence_sentences: The highest oil production was found when the mixture PPO111 was used in the pyrolysis and lowest was found when the PPO811 mixture was used.
The highest oil production was found when the mixture PPO111 was used in the pyrolysis and lowest was found when the PPO811 mixture was used.
The liquid PPO yield obtained from PPO11, PPO211, PPO411 and PPO811 are 83 wt%, 81 wt%, 80 wt% and 78 wt% respectively.
From Fig. 3(a) it can be concluded that the oil yield slightly decreases with the increase of HDPE.

verified_group.group_name: Effect of HDPE mass ratio on distillation product distribution

constants.name: pyrolysis temperature
evidence_sentences: At this temperature, the feedstock undergoes thermal decomposition producing vapor/gas and char.

constants.name: heating rate
evidence_sentences: a heating rate of 6 ◦C/min was set, as well as a pyrolysis temperature of 540 ◦C was set using the PID controller.

constants.name: condenser temperature
evidence_sentences: The vapor was passed through the condenser, where a chiller unit chilled with ethylene glycol was set to 15 ◦C temperature to condense the vapor into liquid oil.

constants.name: pressure inside the reactor
evidence_sentences: The pressure inside the reactor was maintained at 30 kPa, and a pressure-relief valve was fitted to release vapor if the pressure exceeded the required threshold.

constants.name: distillation temperature ranges
evidence_sentences: The distillation temperature was set for gasoline below 170 °C, for diesel between 170 and 350 °C, and for residue above 350 °C.
The figure also reveals that oil from the mixture PPO111 has lowest petrol component (39 wt%) than that of other mixtures (46.5 wt% for PPO211 and 46 wt% for both PPO411 and PPO811 mixtures).
However, PPO111 mixture has the highest amount of residue (8 wt%) among all the other mixtures.

The results show that when the HDPE mass increases, the percentage of diesel in pyrolysis oil changes marginally but petrol increases significantly with the increase of HDPE whereas residue decreases.
However, the amount of residue for PPO411 mixture was higher than PPO211 mixture.

verified_group.group_name: Effect of HDPE mass ratio on fuel properties of distilled diesel
verified_group.variable: mass ratio of HDPE in mixed plastic feedstock

constants.name: pyrolysis temperature
evidence_sentences: At this temperature, the feedstock undergoes thermal decomposition producing vapor/gas and char.

constants.name: heating rate
evidence_sentences: a heating rate of 6 ◦C/min was set, as well as a pyrolysis temperature of 540 ◦C was set using the PID controller.

constants.name: pressure inside the reactor
evidence_sentences: The pressure inside the reactor was maintained at 30 kPa, and a pressure-relief valve was fitted to release vapor if the pressure exceeded the required threshold.

constants.name: condenser temperature
evidence_sentences: The vapor was passed through the condenser, where a chiller unit chilled with ethylene glycol was set to 15 ◦C temperature to condense the vapor into liquid oil.

constants.name: distillation temperature ranges
evidence_sentences: The distillation temperature was set for gasoline below 170 °C, for diesel between 170 and 330 °C, and for the heavy fraction above 330 °C.

constants.name: fuel injection and engine emission characteristics
evidence_sentences: Density of fuel affects the fuel injection in diesel engine and engine emission characteristics.

constants.name: Australian standard for cetane index
evidence_sentences: For all four samples tested exhibited values higher than minimum Australian standard for cetane index.

constants.name: Australian standard for density
evidence_sentences: The diesel obtained from the pyrolysis of PPO111 has higher density and close to the maximum standard value of Australia.

constants.name: Australian standard for kinematic viscosity
evidence_sentences: The KV of crude PPO is below the minimum standard of Australia (1.2635, 1.1, 1.081 and 1.0603 mm²/s for PPO111, PPO211, PPO411 and PPO811 respectively).

constants.name: Australian standard for PAH
evidence_sentences: For the other three samples PAH value was well below the Australian Standard specified.
The figure shows that the cetane index increases significantly with the increase of HDPE amount in the plastic feedstock mixture.
The highest cetane index was found in distilled diesel cut sample PPO811 (58) and lowest was found from PPO111 (46).
From the figure it can be concluded that, with increase in HDPE amount in the plastic mixture KV decreases slightly for all four samples of crude and distilled diesel cut samples tested.
The density decreases with increase of HDPE in the plastic mixture for both crude PPO and DC linearly.
The diesel obtained from the pyrolysis of PPO111 has higher density and close to the maximum standard value of Australia.

verified_group.group_name: Effect of HDPE mass ratio on aromatic hydrocarbon content
verified_group.variable: mass ratio of HDPE in mixed plastic feedstock

constants.name: pyrolysis temperature
evidence_sentences: At this temperature, the feedstock undergoes thermal decomposition producing vapor/gas and char.

constants.name: heating rate
evidence_sentences: a heating rate of 6 ◦C/min was set, as well as a pyrolysis temperature of 540 ◦C was set using the PID controller.

constants.name: pressure inside the reactor
evidence_sentences: The pressure inside the reactor was maintained at 30 kPa, and a pressure-relief valve was fitted to release vapor if the pressure exceeded the required threshold.

constants.name: condenser temperature
evidence_sentences: The vapor was passed through the condenser, where a chiller unit chilled with ethylene glycol was set to 15 ◦C temperature to condense the vapor into liquid oil.

constants.name: distillation temperature ranges
evidence_sentences: The distillation temperature was set for gasoline below 170 °C, and for diesel fraction, the temperature ranges were specified accordingly.

constants.name: type of plastic feedstock mixture
evidence_sentences: The plastic feedstock mixture consisted of HDPE, PS, and PP.
It was noticed that as the percentage of HDPE increases in the plastic feedstock sample the amount of AH and PAH decreases for both crude PPO and distilled diesel cut.
The lowest amount of AH was documented for PPO811 sample which was 24 wt% and 18.81 wt% for crude PPO and distilled diesel fraction respectively.
Whereas, for PPO111 sample the amount of AH was highest (42.8 wt% and 35.1 wt% for crude PPO and distilled diesel fraction respectively) among all the samples tested.
From Fig. 7(b), it can be seen that for all the samples the amount of PAH increases after distillation in the diesel fraction.
